job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in West Saint Paul, MN
pros: Opportunites to pick up as many shifts as you want with bonus pay offered
cons: Can be short staffed at times

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Residents and the underground parking
cons: Poor staffing and low pay

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Time and a half after 8 hours flexibly
cons: You have to work doubles to make a living. The whole company is a mess I wouldn’t recommend this como unless you needed flexibility and a job that gives time and a half

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Excellent residents and staff and nice underground parking.
cons: No staff, you will not get vacation time when you request it, no growth at this company, they practice favoritism and have a clique. A lot of cultural workers and treat them like trash. During the pandemic, they hid all the PPEs and wanted their employees to get sick. You will work as a nursing assistant if you are a nurse because all their NAR ran away because of low pay. Potential employees ask yourself why is this place always hiring? Don't waste your time with this useless employer go look at other places where they are paying higher and have respect for their employees.

job_title: Waitstaff in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Residents are fun and the staff works hard to keep everything fresh
cons:
Horrifying management
zero communication between departments,
this place went through several directors, managers, and waitstaff in just a short time
Zero accountability
zero recognition for staff. Especially nursing and kitchen staff. 
Constantly understaffed

job_title: Resident Assistant in Rush City, MN
pros: Working with seniors can be lots of fun
cons: Usually shorthanded, can be hard to complete all tasks in time allotted

job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Paul, MN
pros: A lot of hours available.
cons:
short staff, don't care about their staff and residents, not a good benefit,
poor pay, overworked, under-appreciated.

review_title: Love the residents and the pay is okay
job_title: Resident Assistant in Lakeville, MN
pros:
The residents are wonderful on the AL/IL side and in the memory care unit.
Memory care unit is still assisted living so transfers are usually one person and most residents don't need heavy assistance with ADLs. 
One RA passes meds in memory care and MC is well staffed at about 8 residents per RA.
Great Life Enrichment department running activities to give you time to finish linen changes and laundry
24 hour nurse- most are very supportive and helpful working with RAs
Three small pay raises across the board in the last 3 years
Great workers
Good benefits for part-timers
cons:
AL is over scheduled and can be overwhelming. 
Care Suites feels like a small nursing home- ten residents who need two person transfers and only two staff members to assist because AL is usually too overwhelmed to help. 
Laundry services are difficult to complete because MC only has one washer/dryer pair and AL competes with residents from IL for limited machines.
Management talks about appreciating workers a lot, but they are very sour about call ins
Pay starts at (and usually stays at) $13 for RAs- less for other departments
On-call staff working .4 or more so there's usually nobody to call when staff is running short
Run short on staff members every couple months
The best RAs leave for hospital jobs

review_title: Wonderful place to start, but no room to grow
job_title: Resident Assistant in West Saint Paul, MN
pros:
Mostly good environment and culture. 
Residents and families are wonderful. 
Good tools and resources provided. 
While I was full-time, benefits balanced nicely.  Pay Is fabulous for CNA.
 Resident care is fabulous, and staff are willing to go above and beyond. No one is ever just sitting. 
Everyone generally flexible.
cons:
Walker Methodist started Striving for better business outcome, aka all rooms full regardless of appropriateness to the care level required, thus making the RA's work load quite difficult, and decreasing the quality of care for all residents in the unit.
Lack of teamwork between RA's, and Ra's/Nurse's.
Didn't feel like I could ask for help from anyone. Expectations and workload a bit high. 
RA's in the memory care/ care suites never got breaks.
Communication needs work.

review_title: Keep Looking! There are better options awaiting you!
job_title: Director of Culinary in Lakeville, MN
pros: The hourly staff members who show up everyday to do the hard work, knowing that they will be short staffed.
cons: Empty promises made by leadership teams to residents. Not equipped enough to handle staff shortages. High turn over compared to length of time it takes to hire. Staff members consistently covering multiple shifts due to a lack of staffing. Human resources slow to source qualified candidates. Low pay for hourly workers that are not competitive with the market. required to generate revenue in order to buy equipment which is needed to operate. Broken systems that do not clearly define the expectation of the employer.  Lack of training and poor management.

job_title: Nursing Assistant in West Saint Paul, MN
pros: This was my first nursing assistant job after my certification and they promote positions for newly certified CNAs so I applied and got in. They have a great orientation with food, free prizes, and lots of good information over the course of three days. You must attend the full three days to be able to work. Once I started working everyone is very helpful and nice, with exception of some nurses who are too snooty to help you with a patient.
cons: Everyone is quitting because it gets so crazy and people are become apathetic. Lots of times they would pull a CNA from our wing to work in another unit, leaving us short-handed and understaffed which in turn makes us not do as good of a job and not getting to patients fast  enough.

job_title: Resident Assistant in Lakeville, MN
pros: Beautiful facility with wonderful amenities. The culture here is supportive, loving, and exciting. There is always something for residents to look forward to whether it's a Gala, happy hour, movie night, or a spa appointment. Wonderful place for a nursing students to learn. CNA's pass medications, check blood glucose, and perform catheter cares. The ability to float from assisted living, dependent living, memory care, and care suites is nice.
cons: Nurse turnover was a big con for me. Every time I came home from college there would be new nurses in training. Another issue was staff not showing for their shifts and being mandated to work late on school nights.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Edina, MN
pros:
I have had several jobs over the last 35 years, I can honestly say that this is one of the best. I work with wonderful people, that are caring, respectful and are willing to listen to your opinions, concerns and questions. With in the first two weeks I felt right at home, I was welcomed in by my peers, the residents and all of my co workers. 
Are they short staffed at times? Yes! If any one can tell me a senior living facility that is not short staffed, I want to applaud them.
cons: My con would be there isn't more communities with the grace and love that walker care suites staff has.

review_title: Great Company Culture, a good place to start a career
job_title: Fitness Technician in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Wonderful residents, passionate staff and a positive company culture. Relative scheduling flexibility depending on your position, good work-life balance, realistic expectations and strong leadership team. It's good to work with people who care about you as a person and not just what position you fill! Great company values, as well!
cons: Depending on your position, not a lot of room for growth or development. Lack of communication between leadership levels, and sometimes a disconnect between leadership and the workforce. Overall, some growing pains but my experience has been good.

job_title: Concierge in Cambridge, MN
pros: Amazing co-workers!  Everyone is willing to help each other out even if it's "not their job."  We truly work at a great community.  The management is really approachable and encouraging as well as open to listening to employee complaints.  If they have an issue with you they will let you know, but they also want to help you grow-- they are always talking about career advancement opportunities!
cons: Honestly every workplace has its issues and if I try hard to think about it I would say that Walker Methodist Levande can have issues with communication, but that being said they are always working on the issues and do not ignore employee concerns.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Cambridge, MN
pros: Directors are willing to work all shift and in any department that needs a hand. I have personally seen the DOH, HSD, LIfe enrichment Director, and Maintenance Director help or work a NOC shift. Current staff is happy and there is such a positive atmosphere.  Love the residents and the can do-can help attitude I see.  Residents love it here they share this whenever asked.
cons: New building so there are some kinks to work out and challenges as it continues to grow.

job_title: Director of Culinary in Minneapolis, MN
pros: The residents were the best part of the job and  made it worth going to.  Didn't pay for a meal the whole time I was there.
cons: Worked 60hr Weeks, always going in on my days off. Very hard to take time off. No bonuses or other forms of incentives were offered.

review_title: Great place to work if you're in school!
job_title: Concierge in Anoka, MN
pros: I loved being at the front desk as I got to do what I loved and had some spare time to do homework.
cons: Not many cons when it comes to the environment besides one of my co workers who was very unpleasant to work with.

job_title: Nursing Assistant in Lakeville, MN
pros: Good experience if you want to know what it's like to work in long term homes. You get to administer meds a lot and make residents happy with assisting them to their daily activities.
cons: Definitely under paid!! Work can be stressful and very busy at times. Also everytimeni would request time off, it got denied. Even if it was month in advance.

job_title: in Minneapolis, MN
pros: The nursing/management staff cares about their employees, the residents we care for are appreciative, and we are held accountable for any errors as well as given positive reinforcement when we exceed any expectations.
cons: As most health care facilities, being short-staffed can cause extra stress at times.

job_title: Resident Assistant in Cambridge, MN
pros: The residents and their families
cons: Management's immaturity and failure to demonstrate quality leadership.

job_title: ADON in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Management is inclusive with all staff and listen to the staffs concerns.  Walker Methodist believes in their values and mission statement and lives it every day.  They promote their staff within.
cons: Big company.  Can be political with corporate at times

job_title: Resident Assistant in Anoka, MN
pros: Management is strong and well-respected. Awesome communication amongst all teams.
cons: The work is rigorous as some of you may know in health care but there needs to be a pay increase. You can't make a living off the hourly rate.

review_title: Okay company, management favors certain employees
job_title: Resident Assistant in West Saint Paul, MN

review_title: The Best Place to Work and Live
